author: zsfelfoldi
content:
<@!552133098075193354> <@!301186049323958275> feeHistory spec: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/pull/212
I also want to write a bit more detailed human readable doc based on the original proposal (that also covers the supported block history length issue and some corner cases) but I'm a bit lost with all our repos ðŸ™‚ What is the most "official" and up to date place for API documentation now?

author: sky.cactus
content: We don't currently have a great place for API *documentation*, only *specifications*.

author: zsfelfoldi
content: Well, formal specs are the most important, it's just that there are a few bits of info I'd like to clarify. Should I just cram those into the description fields then?

author: sky.cactus
content: That is what I would recommend I think.

author: zsfelfoldi
content: thanks, replied and updated descriptions/field names.
